summary: This is a U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) internal memorandum (UMR) notifying the Office of the Attorney General about the planned release of approximately 2,700 pages of Bureau of Prisons (BOP) documents related to Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration and suicide. The release is part of FOIA litigation with The New York Times and follows deferred prosecution agreements with the guards accused of falsifying records.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein's Suicide at MCC
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein committed suicide by hanging while housed in the Special Housing Unit at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC).

events.title: Deferred Prosecution Agreements with Guards
events.description: The USAO-SDNY entered into deferred prosecution agreements with BOP guards Tova Noel and Michael Thomas, who were accused of falsifying records on the night of Epstein's suicide.

events.title: Planned Release of BOP Documents
events.description: The USAO-SDNY plans to release approximately 2,700 pages of BOP documents related to Epstein's incarceration and suicide to The New York Times as part of FOIA litigation.

locations: New York City Office of the Medical Examiner (OCME)
keyFacts: Approximately 2,700 pages of BOP documents regarding Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration and suicide were scheduled for release on July 2, 2021, to The New York Times.
The documents were previously withheld due to the criminal prosecution of guards Tova Noel and Michael Thomas, which concluded with deferred prosecution agreements in May 2021.

The documents include internal BOP memoranda detailing failures that allowed Epstein to kill himself, his psychological records, the autopsy report, and internal emails showing confusion on the day of his death.

A notable item among the documents is a photograph of a defaced sign in the Special Housing Unit that stated rounds on Epstein were 'mandatory, signed "God,"' which had been altered to include a question mark after 'mandatory.'
The autopsy report by the New York City OCME concluded Epstein committed suicide by hanging.
